Economic Ramifications: During periods of conflict, the economy can experience a range of adverse effects.
This can lead to economic difficulties that impact the cost of living, employment opportunities, and various
other aspects. As reported by Reuters(2023), the Bank of Israel has reduced its economic growth projections
for 2023 from 3% to 2.3%. Consequently, Israelis may opt to curtail their consumption expenditures and opt
to save funds in preparation for unforeseen circumstances arising from the current uncertainty.
